newsitem.title: USA: Compass Group to buy Service America.
newsitem.headline: Compass Group to buy Service America.

text.p: Compass Group Plc said on Friday it is buying the dining and vending food service assets of Service America for $119.2 million.

The consideration of $119.2 million is payable in cash of up to $8.2 million payable on completion, $20 million of loan notes issuable at completion and the issuance of 10,275,185 ordinary shares of Compass, the company said.
The shares are payable in four equal six month installments beginning March 31, 1997, Compass said.

Compass Group said it expects to take $10 million in charges related to the acquisition in the period to September 29, 1996 and will largely be incurred over the next 18 months as it attempts to combine its business with Service America.
Compass Group said Service America operates over 7,000 dining and vending accounts across 36 states in the U.S. and this business employs almost 13,000 people.
Service America unit, which will be acquired debt free, had pretax losses for the year to March 30, 1996 period of $12.9 million, Compass Group said.
